system_info.update_log: Comprehensive patch to address missing rules, definitions, and AI directives from the original dataset.

new_ai_directives.purpose: These directives should be added to the `ai_instructions` section of the `GM_AI_Tools.json` file to improve AI behavior.

directives.description: Add a new core directive instructing the AI to first refer to the `Master_Index.json` to locate the correct file for any given piece of information.

rules: Avoid Repetition: Avoid repeating phrases, sentences, or concepts that have been used in the past three turns.
Maintain Focus: Keep dialogue relevant to the current quest or character's narrative hook.
Character Nuance: Reference character personalities from the `World_Codex` and `Characters.json` for unique dialogue.
Dynamic Quest Creation: When a narrative event presents a clear task or objective, log it as a new quest in `active_quests`.
Streamlined Quests: Keep the `active_quests` list focused and only add a new quest when a new goal is introduced.
Accurate Logging: Upon completion, move the quest to the `completed_quests` list with a description that reflects the party's success.
Zael's Awakening: Add a rule to check for an `is_awakened` flag on Zaelâ€™s character sheet. If `true`, replace his 'Path of the Void-Touched' talent tree with the 'Path of the Dragon' tree.

directives.rules: Upon player request, end the session by recapping events and finalizing the `Campaign_State.json` with an updated timestamp.

rules_and_glossary_updates.purpose: These definitions and rules should be added to the `System_Core.json` file or a new `Rules_Glossary.json` file for consistency.

status_effects.name: Ablaze
status_effects.description: The target is engulfed in fire. It takes 1d8 fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the fire is extinguished. [cite: 3523, 3524, 3525]

status_effects.name: Bleeding
status_effects.description: The target takes 1d6 physical damage at the start of its turn from a deep wound. [cite_start]This can be ended by a healing ability or a successful Mind (Survival) check. [cite: 3527, 3528, 3529]

status_effects.name: Slowed
status_effects.description: The target's movement speed is halved, and they have a -1 penalty to all Agility checks. [cite: 3531, 3532, 3533]

status_effects.name: Deafened
status_effects.description: A deafened creature can't hear and automatically fails any checks that require it. [cite: 3535, 3536, 3537]

status_effects.name: Confused
status_effects.description: A confused creature cannot take reactions and must roll a d10 at the start of its turn to determine its action. [cite: 3540, 3541]

status_effects.name: Diseased
status_effects.description: The afflicted creature takes a -2 penalty to its maximum Vitality and Resolve until cured. [cite: 3543, 3544, 3545]

status_effects.name: Paralyzed
status_effects.description: An incapacitated creature that cannot move or speak. [cite_start]Attacks against it have advantage. [cite: 3548, 3549]

status_effects.name: Broken
status_effects.description: An item that is broken is unusable until it is repaired. A broken weapon can't be used to attack, and a broken piece of armor or a shield provides no benefit to the wearer.

area_of_effect.radius: A circular area that expands from a central point. All creatures within the circle are affected.
area_of_effect.cone: A triangular area that originates from the caster and extends outwards in a specific direction.
area_of_effect.line: A straight line that extends from the caster in a specific direction. All creatures in the line are affected.

movement_types.push: To move a creature away from you. The creature is moved the specified number of feet in a straight line.
movement_types.pull: To move a creature toward you. The creature is moved the specified number of feet in a straight line.
movement_types.teleport: To move from one space to another instantly. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

damage_types.necrotic: Damage that drains life force or vitality.
damage_types.arcane: Damage from raw, untyped magical energy.
damage_types.entropic: Damage that causes decay and unraveling.
damage_types.sonic: Damage from sound waves or vibrations.
damage_types.light: Damage from holy or radiant energy.

bestiary_updates.purpose: This shows the new structure for monster entries. This format should be applied to all monsters in the `Bestiary.json` file.

monster_template.name: Goo Ball
monster_template.description: A small, gelatinous blob of pure mana. They are the simplest of magical life forms, often found near mana-rich Ley Lines. [cite_start]They are naturally docile and only attack when threatened. [cite: 4547, 4551, 4552, 4557, 4558]

behavior.social: Solitary, but will merge to form a King Goo when threatened. [cite: 4555]
behavior.tactics: Bounces around the battlefield and splits when hit. [cite_start]It's a simple, unpredictable foe. [cite: 4556, 4571, 4575]
behavior.notes: Vulnerable to most physical damage but can regenerate. [cite_start]They have no strong elemental ties. [cite: 4557]

abilities.name: Split
abilities.effect: The first time the Goo Ball is hit, it splits into two smaller Goo Balls, each with half the current Vitality. [cite: 4575]
